Articles.Content: I designed a truck to use to transfer fuel between ships on the Mun and I tested it on Kerbin but once I got it to the Mun, when I press the forward key it goes forward and to the left. I checked that none of the wheels are locked or steering locked but I cant seem to figure it out. Here is a pic. Any ideas? Any ideas for improvements? It handles like crap on the Mun. The one landing gear it down to hold it in place, that is not the cause

Looks to me like you have poor symmetry... all your left girders/wheels seem to be lower than your right. Look at your left rear wheel, you can clearly tell that the girder is lower, since you can even see the opposite one above the central girder. Same goes for the central and even front wheels/girders.

Not to mention you have a landing leg down on the front right side.
I've had this problem too. Just right-click on your ship core and click "Disable torque." KSP still thinks that you're in space, and not on the Mun.
